alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 5:12PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Oklahoma and north central Cleveland Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 512 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over southern Oklahoma City, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Oklahoma City, Moore, Midwest City, Del City, Valley Brook and Tinker Air Force Base. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 118 and 125. Interstate 40 between mile markers 156 and 157. Interstate 44 between mile markers 114 and 117. Interstate 240 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
